Posts.Content: May 30, 2014 02:17AM ej01 wrote: I also had DCIS, removed by lumectomy in Sept 2011 followed by radiation.   March 2014 I had suspicious calcifications in my other breast.  I was sure it was DCIS again.  I had a surgical biopsy last week (they could not get to the area with needle biopsy) and got the word it was B9!  I was totally not expecting that.  My story is a lot like yours and i just got my HAPPY ending...for now.  Hopefully you will too.   I totally understand the questions, fears, etc of a possible 2nd cancer.   I am just wondering if this will be my new cycle of fear for the future...every few years having more suspicious calcifications show up and getting biopsy...and worrying.
Posts.Title: Cancer, rinse, repeat ? bluewillowskys AlexaP

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2014 11:34AM ej01 wrote: Congrats on the good news!
Posts.Title: Consult with surgeon tomorrow Alemap118 Monis

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2011 10:59AM ej01 wrote: Miles2go:  I applaud your post to get people to do their own research and make informed decision.   That is certainly important.  You commented that "my surgeon tells me radiation is no longer recommended for DCIS & has not been for 10 years."   That may be true for your particular diagnosis (size, grade, age, etc) or your particular surgeon's views.  But in general the medical community still  does recommend radiation for many patients with larger DCIS, close margins, young, or high grade DCIS.    There is some concern that DCIS is getting overtreated in some instances and radiation is one area of DCIS that is undergoing a lot of research right now.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed~information & choices! Miles2Go otter

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2011 12:24PM ej01 wrote: It takes a few days between biopsy and final results.    Think positive!  You are doing the right think by getting it diagnosed.
Posts.Title: 20 Years old...tests tomorrow KyAnne PinkShirtNow

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 11:50AM ej01 wrote: Kaara,  Do ask about partial breast radiation.  There are different types depending on your circumstances (mamosite, savi, or external PBI), and they are an example of a local treatment which will radiate the places in your breast most likely to get a reoccurance... the area around the original cancer.  I believe there are still ongoing studies for most of these techniques to help assess the true long term risk as compared with whole breast radiation.  I had the 5 day external radiation, had virtually no side effects.  Because my cancer was on the left side, I have to assume there is less potential impact to the heart (although the RO did say that with the newer machines and techniques even whole breast radiation does not impact the heart/lungs like it used to).
